instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hello

i'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
the board looks pretty much ok
no liquid damage, doesn't seem like been tampered with before

but still, no power...
from reading around the board, i get this results..

On F4700 is 5.17v on both sides

<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is 0.020v


i know that low voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is many times related to a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> caused by <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>
but in this case <SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> is present and resistance to ground is around 300 ohms.

any help would be appreciated..

thanks..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: PPBUS present and LED next to battery connector lighting up? It could still be a half dead <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi duke

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is present (8.6v)

the little led is glowing when connected...

but still, no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
and obviously no <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Start with <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>. I assume you have tried a known good USB-C port cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi

so after replacing <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> i got all the rails..
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is 14.7v and got cpu vcore (1.7v)

after putting the board back to the machine i get no image on screen, no chime.. only feedback from the forcetouch trackpad when charger connecrted..
this is actually the machine from an older thread of mine, with a "new" board -
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/36673-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-power[/url]

it's behaving the same as the original board of this machine, it gets cpu vcore but still dead...

also no response to smc reset \ pram reset...
on the oriignal board for this machine it was concluded as brain dead..
what are the odds that the second board intended for this machine was <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> bad and than brain dead?
i'm a bit puzzled by this...

what else can cause this? bad keyboard\ trackpad ? bad screen? usb connector?
should this board chime with only one speaker connected when its OK?

thanks...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Audio jack board must be connected for it to chime. Get a USB-C to USB adapter and connect a mouse and see if it lights up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hi
ok will get a usb-c hub and check, because also need the charger to be connected..

the audio jack was connected, still no chime..

will update after checking with usb mouse..
